courses.title: Rhetoric and Composition I
courses.prerequisite: For all 010 courses: Satisfactory scores on English portion of ACT test and TSI examination or ENGL 0301. For ENGL 1302, a grade of 'C' or better in ENGL 1301.

courses.title: Precalculus
courses.prerequisite: MATH 1314 or MATH 1414 with a grade of 'C' or better; or passing the College Algebra Exemption Test administered by the Department of Mathematics.
courses.notes: One credit hour from MATH 2412 is applied to the Support Course section of the degree plan.

courses.title: Introduction to Programming in Python
courses.prerequisite: Concurrent enrollment or credit for MATH 1314 or higher level mathematics course.

courses.title: Learning Framework
courses.notes: As required, based on credit hours earned, TSI status, High School rank, major declaration.

courses.title: Rhetoric and Composition II
courses.prerequisite: For all 010 courses: Satisfactory scores on English portion of ACT test and TSI examination or ENGL 0301. For ENGL 1302, a grade of 'C' or better in ENGL 1301.

courses.title: Foundations of Systems I
courses.prerequisite: 'C' or better in Math 2412 and CSCI 1380; and must be officially admitted to the cyber security major or minor.

courses.title: Foundations of Systems II
courses.prerequisite: 'C' or better in Math 2412 and CSCI 1380; and must be officially admitted to the cyber security major or minor.

courses.title: Programming of Cyber Systems & Reverse Engineering
courses.prerequisite: 'C' or better in Math 2412 and CSCI 1380; and must be officially admitted to the cyber security major or minor.

courses.title: Applied Statistics for Health
courses.prerequisite: MATH 1314, MATH 1414, MATH 1324, or MATH 1342 with a grade of 'C' or better.

courses.title: Life and Physical Sciences
courses.notes: PHYS 1401 recommended (prerequisite: MATH 1314). See Core Curriculum for course options. [lab credit hour (1) applied toward free elective]

courses.title: Data Communications and Networking
courses.prerequisite: 'C' or better in CYBI 2322, CYBI 2324, CYBI 2326.

courses.title: Intrusion Detection, Incident Response and Information Assurance
courses.prerequisite: Pre- or co-requisite in CYBI 3335.

courses.title: Business Law I
courses.prerequisite: Sophomore Standing. All students pursuing a Bachelor of Business Administration, Bachelor of Arts in Economics, or Bachelor of Science in Materials Management and Logistics, or Bachelor of Science in Hospitality and Tourism Management from VCoBE, must apply for and be admitted to VCoBE before they are allowed to enroll in the Advanced Business Core and Major coursework for their degree.
courses.notes: Contact business.advising@utrgv.edu for permission to enroll in the course.

courses.title: Operating Systems and Security
courses.prerequisite: 'C' or better in CYBI 2322, CYBI 2324, and CYBI 2326.

courses.title: Digital Forensics
courses.prerequisite: 'C' or better in CYBI 2322, CYBI 2324, and CYBI 2326.

courses.title: Life and Physical Sciences
courses.notes: PHYS 1402 recommended (prerequisite: PHYS 1401). See Core Curriculum for course options. [lab credit hour (1) applied toward free elective]

courses.title: Distributed and Cloud Computing Security
courses.prerequisite: Pre- or co-requisite in CYBI 3335.

courses.title: Software Engineering and Project Management
courses.prerequisite: 'C' or better in CYBI 2322, CYBI 2324, and CYBI 2326.

courses.title: Certification
courses.prerequisite: Sophomore, Junior, or Senior standing.

courses.title: Wireless and Mobile Security
courses.prerequisite: CYBI 3335.

courses.title: Cryptography
courses.prerequisite: Grade of 'C' or better in CYBI 2322, CYBI 2324, and CYBI 2326.

courses.title: Network Security
courses.prerequisite: CYBI 3335.

courses.title: Business Information Infrastructure
courses.prerequisite: Sophomore Standing. All students pursuing a Bachelor of Business Administration, Bachelor of Arts in Economics, or Bachelor of Science in Hospitality and Tourism Management from VCoBE, must apply for and be admitted to VCoBE before they can enroll in the Advanced Business Core and Major coursework for their degree. Prerequisites are waived for the students pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Cyber Security or a minor in Cyber Security.
courses.notes: Contact business.advising@utrgv.edu for permission to enroll in the course.
